title: Systems Administrator/Engineer (Linux)
description: • Directly responsible for ensuring high availability and successful auditing of Big Data Operations and HPC systems • Administrates several Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), CentOS, Microsoft Windows and VMware workstations and servers • Installs, configures and applies DISA STIGs for security hardening on Linux and Windows based systems • Utilizes and configures IT automation software such as Puppet, Cobbler and Docker • Investigates and resolves system outages and anomalies • Manages builds, packages, and systems in a virtual environment harnessing platforms such as OpenStack, VMware, Hyper-V, and Citrix • Monitors and tunes RedHat systems • Plans and effectively evaluates IP addressing and DNS schemes in a production environment • Examines system issues as reported by various users, including but not limited to networking, application and firewall issues • Exercises strong communication skills, while working in a team environment • Creates processes and documentation standards • Applies various operating system patches (Windows, ESX and Red Hat) including COTS/FOSS patches • Demonstrates strong composure by working in a fast-paced environment • Alerts onsite personnel of system outages, and works alongside others to fix the issues at hand • Coordinates with factory engineering as appropriate to solve operational issues • Troubleshoots multiple application packages

title: Informtion Warfare Officer
description: - Serves as a technical manager in all phases of operations conducted by the Commander Tenth Fleet, including signals intelligence, Electronic Warfare, Computer Network Operations. - Exercises control of subordinate commands and assigned forces to cyber missions. - Monitored the global picture for threats to the Global Information Grid, communications outages and efforts to restore normal operations, and coordinated SIGINT activities with subordinate Task Forces. - Reported Activity meeting the Commander's Critical Information Requirements to the chain of command and coordinated response efforts with subordinate commands. - Brief the Admiral daily. - Drafted and Release operational reports and messages. - Supervised the Watch Team which was comprised of Network Operations, Defensive Cyber Operations, Intelligence, and Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) Watch positions. - Direct liaison with Chief of Naval Operations, Fleet Commanders, Joint and National Agency Staffs'. - Trained numerous Battle Watch Captains, Assistant Battle Watch Captains, and Staff Duty Officers. - Subject Matter Expert in Cyber Operations. - Developed Joint Mission Essential Task List for reporting in the Defense Readiness Reporting System (DRRS). - Member of the Operational Planning Team providing valuable insight into the capabilities of the Logistics and Readiness Cell. Provide both real world and exercise planning. - Provide monthly report to the Commander Tenth Fleet on Task Force readiness. - Coordinate readiness issues with all echelons of the Navy command structure.
name: Jason Dodd

title: Technical Liason Officer (TLO)/Senior Watch Officer (SWO)
description: Technical Liaison Officer: - Assigned to Foreign Affairs Directorate to support the strategic goals. - Provided operational support to including leading of specialized teams in OCONUS deployments, equipment testing and installation, mission management, Signals collection, research and traffic analysis, technical training and system engineering. - Assisted in the development, coordination, and implementation of short and long range plans that address mutual goals, intelligence requirements, strategies, priorities, and resources. - Procured, Installed and trained Coalition and Third Party Partners on systems. Global Network Exploitation and Vulnerabilities Analyst/Manager: - Developed a comprehensive certification program to qualify 4 watch teams comprised of joint personnel to increase ANO’s effectiveness in supporting NTOC. - Coordinated operations of three Naval Reserve stations supporting ANO Division requirements. - Integrated Army Reserve personnel from the 1st Information Operations Command into the ANO Reserve infrastructure, coordinating their training and certification in support of ANO operations. - Served as global network operations manager; monitors, collects, and reports information and conducts actions in direct support of computer network operations worldwide in support of Navy, National Security Agency, Department of Defense, and national and theater level missions. - Provided time-sensitive cryptologic support for NSA's Information Assurance operational missions by maintaining situational awareness of world events. - Daily duties required a thorough understanding of cyber threats, vulnerabilities, defensive measures, Information Assurance principles and the capabilities of DoD networks and how to secure them. - Authorized Cyber Operations in the ROC through four globally dispersed operations centers. - Led daily operations in the ROC conducted by 361 Joint Personnel from all services of the armed forces and several law enforcement agencies.
name: Jason Dodd

title: Signals Warfare Officer
description: - As Signals Warfare Officer, I was multi-hatted and served in the following capacities as primary manager (Electronic Warfare, Special Security Officer, Assistant Security Manager, Operational Security (OPSEC) Officer, and Information Systems Officer). Specific accomplishments are listed below: - Tracked and monitored the installation of Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) Networks system. - Implemented an aggressive training program to ensure continued proficiency and coordinated with Center for Information Dominance Learning Site, San Diego to ensure all training required was completed in a timely fashion. - Supported multiple taskforces and commanders. - Tracked and monitored the installation of NULKA. - Conducted 73 intelligence briefings, resulting in the nomination by the Immediate Superior in Command (ISIC) for the Intelligence Excellence Award. - Managed the personal security investigations of 261 personnel, and counseled 13 personnel on procedures corresponding with the Department of the Navy Clearance adjudication facility. - Maintained the classified holdings of both the Electronic Warfare Spaces and Ship's Signal Exploitation Space (SSES). - Directed communication activities of command’s SCI Communications systems. - Supervised subordinates in the handling and security of classified information; operation security (OPSEC/COMSEC), administrative directives, communications management, and organization, signals officer management, and organization; message drafting and communications equipment, and systems (conventional, automated and satellite). - Managed and trained 21 Cryptologic personnel and resources assigned to a USS BUNKER HILL (CG 52) for the provision of direct support to the operational commander in the areas of signal intelligence and communication security. - Served as cryptologic advisor to the operational commander. - Maintained special intelligence operations and Order of Battle files.
name: Jason Dodd

title: Instructor/Inspector
description: Primary Instructor/Inspector: - Trained 4 different rates to include CTR, CTT, IT, CTA, totaling 120 sailors on 9 ships of varying class (CV/CVN/CG/DDG/LHA). - Lead Instructor for Cryptologic Communications Afloat Training (CCAT) for 9 classes totaling 75 personnel. - Administered the Cryptologic Warfare Area Level of knowledge exams and conducted CART-II, FEP , ULTRA-C, ULTRA- S Certifications. - Provided tailored afloat training to 11 Surface Fleet Units and 130 personnel. - Selected for Sailor of the Quarter for 2nd and 4th Quarters 2005. - Selected Sailor of the Year for Afloat Training Group Norfolk and Afloat Training Group Atlantic CY 2005. - Developed Curriculum in accordance with long term plans and revisions. - Developed a database to track the completion of General Military Training for 436 personnel, providing monthly progress reports to leadership. - Certified Master Training Specialist - Departmental Career Counselor for 139 personnel. Special Security Representative: - Managed the Personnel Security Program for the commands SCI Access for 21 personnel. Reviewed and submitted 15 EPSQ investigation packages. System Administrator: - Sole manager of the Command SCI Database and SCI Excepted Network. - Commands Information Systems Security Officer for SCI and Top Secret Networks. Fleet Integrated Communications Specialist: - Sends and receives communications processing systems; maintains logs, records, files, and publications; performs computer software installations and updates applications. - Prepared operations and technical reports; plans and conducted operations; identifiesd the purpose of the various special security communications systems and networks operated by naval security; supervised and evaluated subordinates.
name: Jason Dodd

title: Operations/Training Manager
company: Commander, Submarine Force U.S. Pacific Fleet
description: Operations Manager: - Managed four SCI communications systems and networks to near 100% reliability. - Developed and programmed a database to track training and advancement requirements for over 200 personnel on staff. - Coordinated COMSUBPAC's first installation of SCI Capable EHF terminal and developed the Systems Security Plan required for SCI Accreditation. - Trained four watch teams on three newly installed communication systems. - Maintained mission critical systems in support of special submarine operations. Training Manager: - Revamped the qualification process for the Special Intelligence Communications Center, resulting in 27 topics, 41 power point lectures and increase in the overall readiness of the unit. Information Systems Administrator: - Primary System Administrator for six servers to include Windows NT 4.0, Windows Server 2000, Exchange Server 5.5, an Internet Information Servers and 44 work stations. - Configured and installed operating systems, installed system updates and application programs (including additions, modifications, and enhancements), implement security software changes and coordinate installation and testing of new hardware and verification of correct system operations. - Manage user accounts to include determining user requirements and qualifications, determining user logical associations with remainder of user population. - Restore password and account privileges and removes accounts. - Monitors user file space, system activity, system security, coordinate user training and perform computer house-keeping functions to support system day to day operations and networking operations. - Monitored Networks, ADP security, data management, system/LAN administration, and programming techniques. - Manage/maintain internal site networks to include but not limited to MS Exchange, NetWare, and Windows NT. - Conduct first level network software and hardware corrective actions.
name: Jason Dodd

title: Fleet Integrated Communications Specilist
description: - Managed and administered integrated cryptologic information systems and networks that provided tactical or strategic operational intelligence to Tactical Commanders and Strategic Planners both ashore and afloat. - Performed quality control assurance and fault isolation on communications circuits and networks. - Configured and operated complex cryptologic data communications equipment. - Operates both TACINTEL Subscriber and TLCF Communications System. - Prepares outage logs and reports and maintains circuit quality. - Conducted training on the proper equipment testing procedures, basic circuit theory and EKMS Handling, resulting in the successful completion of shipboard operational certification with 100% circuit reliability. - Revamped the Basic Communications Operator Job Qualification Requirement resulting in increased proficiency of all personnel. - Supervised Cryptologic Direct Support Element (CDSE) watch standers during SIGINT Operations in support of Joint Inter-Agency Task Force (JIATF) East operations. - CDSE Elements EKMS Custodian. - Develop and trained communications operators both afloat and ashore. - Sends and receives communications processing systems; maintains logs, records, files, and publications. - Prepares operations and technical reports; plans and conducts operations; identifies the purpose of the various special security communications systems and networks. - Supervises and evaluates subordinates. - Proficient in the use of oral and written communication in professional relationships; the role of motivation, empowerment, and counseling in development of subordinate; and ways to manage human resources, teams, and stress to create a quality organizational climate.
name: Jason Dodd

education.name: The University of Texas at Austin

title: Owner- DECA Multimedia, Partner- The Edge Group Partners
description: I founded DECA as a full service multimedia and advertising company with in-house capabilities in Branding, Advertising, Press management, Animation, Collateral Design and Print, Large Format Print, Copy, Web Design, Multimedia Print, Photography and Audio and Video production. The Edge Group was subsequently founded to focus on the interactive, database driven web application initiatives. A notable success was the partnership development of a fully intearactive training web application used at major Oil and Gas service companies for OSHA training requirement and IADC certification. The software was developed using ASP.net, mySQL, and boasted features such as full client interactivity including content modification and module creation, real time text to speech, robust delivery media versatility, disk download for offline use and multiple language selection. Content flexibility offered a platform for use across multiple industries for the purpose of training. The project lasted 3 years and was developed hand-in-glove with the end user clientele.

title: Account Executive
description: During this period of transition from my tenure at Dow Chemical I trained for and passed the Series 7 Financial Course of Study and had the fortune of training with my company for 3 months at the World Trade Center. I eventually opted to stay in engineering after a year. Before leaving New York, I was fortunate enough to have a training session closing dinner at the Windows of the World restaurant atop WTC. God bless the individuals that perished there as well as the other locations that fateful day in our history.
